original_title: Appeals, complaints pile up at NPC due to work force shortage
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); More than 12,000 complaints, including appeals received from police officers, have been piled up in the National Police Commission due to the shortage of officers.

An official attached to the National Police Commission said numerous complaints that were directed to the Public Services Commission were redirected to the NPC following the passage of the 21st Amendment to the Constitution.

However, almost half of the staff serving at the National Police Commission at the time were placed on retirement, said the official, adding that at present the NPC functions with around 70 officials, while it requires a minimum staff of 150 personnel.
The official noted that requests were made from the Ministry of Public Administration and the Department of Management Services to recruit more officers, however, those requests have gone unanswered.
